bill_title: revise certain statutes relating to the eligibility of individual's employed by certain schools for unemployment benefits.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise certain statutes relating to the eligibility of individual's employed by certain schools for unemployment benefits. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 61-1 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Notwithstanding subdivision 61-1-10.4(3), employment includes services performed by an individual in the employ of an elementary or secondary school operated by the federal government who is furloughed in a nonpay status as defined in section 2 of this Act Section 2. That chapter 61-6 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: The exception in § § 61-6-1.2 and 61-6-1.3 that disqualifies an individual because the individual performs services in an educational institution does not disqualify an individual who is furloughed in a nonpay status while in the employ of an elementary or secondary school operated by the federal government. Furloughed in a nonpay status means an individual employed in a full-time career position by an elementary or secondary school operated by the federal government or an agency of the federal government and is put on a leave of absence with no work and no pay for a period exceeding two weeks.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date
